DOC.brief_summary: Standard antipsychotic drug regimens do not fully address the impact of cognitive symptoms associated with schizophrenia. The NMDA receptor has been connected to the pathophysiology of schizophrenia. Memantine is an uncompetitive NMDA receptor antagonist. It is hypothesized that adjunctive therapy with memantine will reduce NMDA receptor hyperactivity, improving signal to noise ratio and thereby improving cognitive symptoms.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Memantine as Adjunctive Treatment in Schizophrenia Patients
DOC.criteria: DSMIV diagnosed Schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder who are on a stable antipsychotic regimen with Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) total score greater than or equal to 26 and greater than or equal to 4 on at least one item Secondary diagnosis of Bipolar I disorder Suicidal history Organic brain disease Dementia History of substance abuse
